N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 71.5 - Police procedures

State Regulations
(a) Upon impounding a motor vehicle or
trailer because of the possibility of its being stolen, the police shall
inquire from the National Crime Information Center, either directly or
indirectly, to learn the name and address of the owner. If this procedure is
unsuccessful, but the vehicle has number plates, the police shall inquire of
the motor vehicle registration agency of the state which issued the
plates. (b) Upon learning the name
and address of the true owner of a vehicle, the police shall send such person a
letter informing him of the location of his vehicle and advising him that he
may either claim it within 20 days or within 20 days after it is no longer
needed as evidence. (c) Upon
failure of a person to claim his vehicle, the police shall dispose of the
vehicle in accordance with section
423-a
of the Vehicle and Traffic Law. Notes
